abstract: A lawyer representing five G.M. accident victims told DealBook that, despite filing an appeal of a judge’s approval of the carmaker’s planned asset sale, he’s not looking to block it.
snippet: A lawyer representing five G.M. accident victims told DealBook that, despite filing an appeal of a judge’s approval of the carmaker’s planned asset sale, he’s not looking to block it.
lead_paragraph: Update | 4:56 p.m. An unofficial committee of dissident General Motors bondholders said Monday afternoon that it was not likely to appeal the company’s planned sale, citing the “enormous costs expected to be incurred” in that process.

headline.main: Hurdles to G.M.’s Sale Plan Fall Away

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
